SWS: More Filipinos experience hunger during the 2nd quarter of 2023
inquirer.net

MANILA, Philippines — More Filipinos suffer from hunger. The June 2023 Social Weather Stations (SWS) Second Quarter study released
inquirer.net

primary.title: 180 families evacuated in Taguig due to heavy rains
primary.description: The Taguig City government preemptively evacuated 180 families due to continuous heavy rains enhanced by typhoons “Falcon” and “Egay.”

secondary.title: Leptospirosis, dengue cases up amid rainy season — DOH - Manila Standard
secondary.description: The country has logged an increase in the number of leptospirosis and dengue cases amid the onset of the rainy season, the Department of Health said Monday. The DOH said 182 new leptospirosis cases were recorded from June 18 to July 1, a 42-percent jump from the 128 cases reported two weeks prior.

secondary.title: Bulacan, Pampanga placed under state of calamity
secondary.description: The provinces of Bulacan and Pampanga have been placed under a state of calamity due to massive flooding and damage caused by the southwest monsoon enhanced by Typhoons Egay and Falcon.

secondary.title: Typhoon Doksuri Displaced More than 4,000 Families in the Philippines | Adventist Review
secondary.description: The North Philippines region endured heavy rains and catastrophic floods as Super Typhoon Egay (international name Doksuri) swamped five regions. The disaster has impacted an estimated population of more than 35 million people.

carousel.title: Ombudsman suspends gov't officials over 'anomalous' onion deal. Here's why.
carousel.description: The respondents face charges for alleged grave misconduct, gross neglect of duty, and conduct prejudicial to the best interest of the service in relation to the government's Kadiwa program

carousel.title: In Philippines, climate change tests Indigenous farming like never before
carousel.description: ILOILO, Philippines — In the mountainous village of Jayobo in the central Philippines, internet and mobile connectivity are spotty. The nearest town center is an hour’s drive along a rough, unpaved road, and electricity has only recently reached the village and remains intermittent.

carousel.title: House committee OKs bill for OFWs voting via internet
carousel.description: A House committee has approved the Overseas Voting Act of 2023, which allows OFWs to vote via the internet.

carousel.title: Philippines legend Alapag earns NBA role with Kings
carousel.description: Philippines basketball legend Jimmy Alapag has been elevated to the Sacramento Kings' coaching staff ahead of the new NBA season.
